author: Holly Royce
title: The verdict is in: Ketchup should be stored in the fridge
text:
(Photo Illustration by Oli Scarff/Getty Images) The ketchup storage debate has been around for as long as ketchup itself has existed.
Marathon training week 10: running through the pain While the world has been quailing under political and social turmoil, the ketchup debate has captivated the attention of hundreds, nay, thousands after polls started to appear and antagonise users of social media.
We did our own poll and it was a super close call for metro readers.

Basically, people feel very strongly about the whole situation.
I could never be with someone that keeps their ketchup in the cupboard not the fridge.
— bee (@pinealpples) February 2, 2017 

Asda has actually changed where they are storing ketchup after 53% of individuals said the condiment should be stored in the fridge.
It turns out that 53% of people were probably correct if the experts of all things domestic at Good Housekeeping at to be believed.
Where to store these condiments, and how long for https://t.co/5YVPCGV8pN pic.twitter.com/f0ichhenVw 
— Good Housekeeping (@GHInstituteUK) March 25, 2017 

Turns out brown sauce, mustard, BBQ and chilli sauce – is also on the fridge list.
Good Housekeeping published a full list of items with their proper storage area, temperature and shelf life.
You can read the full list here .
